page.title: 12Local history
page.content:
In 1944 the countryside for miles around was rocked by a terrible explosion; an ammunition dump stored in an old mine at Fauld was detonated. 62 people were killed altogether. Although the explosion was 3 Km. from Draycott in the Clay very many families were affected as they had relatives working near the mine.
The Royal forest has meant an association with Royalty for many years. There is a tradition that to celebrate jubilees and coronations the villagers build an enormous bonfire on top of a local hill. The bonfire is built in a special way and on the last occassion in 1977 was over 10 m. high. A photograph is usually taken before it is fired of all those who helped to build it, with those who worked hardest sitting nearest the top.
